transcript.content: Joins Previous show with Steve and Ricky mid-conversation with presenter Dermot O'Leary and his Co-Presenter...
We don’t know…
Yeah, The problem with me is it’s like when you multiply anything with nought.
Co-Presenter and Ricky Laugh
To the power of as well…
Nothing ever happens.
Yeah, okay shame.
And I’m a fat little ugly fella like that Reg Varney.
Were there loads of people there that you don’t like and you could go up to afterwards and almost like metaphorically flip the bird?
What’s that mean?
Last week…you know “Flip the Bird”.
You dirty… No.
Middle finger.
And you see I’m married, Steve’s single and he doesn’t…
No what are you talking about…and there’s lots of people there…
I thought it was a euphemism… sorry.
… Who you haven’t got on with in the past, and then they’re all being really nice to you…
We got on with everyone don’t we?
What does “Flip the bird” mean?
Flip the bird means…… you’ve got that hipster thing.
The finger, it means giving the finger.
Yeah but I thought there was a dirty metaphor.
No!
You’re always thinking this!
Don’t bring me down to your level till at least 5 minutes…Coming up after the break we’ve got Steve and Ricky and the lovely Claire will be driving their desk. Alright Claire?
Hello!
Don’t bend over like that Claire.
Sorry!
Put a longer top on or something. You alright boys, you your very studious there.
We are, we’re working hard on the show.
Just working out what we’re gonna play, Dermot. and what order!
Dermot Laughs
Ummm
I love the way you even live the pretence.
What about some Foo Fighters mixed with The Strokes, Ricky?
I wouldn’t mind a bit of The Strokes or New Order, what shall we kick in with?
Err undecided yet Rick probably got some ads to err to help us decide.
That dilemma.
Some advertising.
That dilemma will be revealed in just under four minutes, stick around for it.
Merry Christmas Dermot.
New Order - Crystal
New Order and Crystal on Xfm 104.9 now this is the Ricky Gervais Show obviously.
With Steve Merchant right.
Yeah yeah yeah yeah…
Well they like to know if I’m here.
Take it as red, they don’t like to know.
The fans do.
Yeah, um now that was one of my favourite singles of the year.
Yeah, it’s a good song.
And that’s what we’re going to be doing in this program.
We are going to be playing some of our favourite songs of the year that’s absolutely true.
We’ll also be playing some songs that maybe we don’t like.
Exactly.
Just for the hell of it.
Yeah ‘cause we’re crazy guys!
Yeah.
We never know what’s going to happen next.
No, we don’t.
Err, guess who’s pressing the buttons.
We genuinely don’t!
Well you know who’s pressing the buttons, you can see her but the audience can’t.
That’s why we don’t know what’s going to happen next.
Claire Laughs
It’s Sturgess.
We’ve got Sturgess in.
Claire Sturgess, Xfm’s Claire Sturgess.
Yep, yep.
She’s stayed off it for just a day.
Yeah…
She’s not no no she’s just…
She’s clean for a day.
Are you on methadone or, what you on?
No, no I’m clean now!
You’re actually clean are you? Well done.
Yeah absolutely.
Yeah well done, congratulations yeah!
Ricky and Steve Clap
Thanks
That’s great yeah.
You’re Clean for Christmas! That’s beautiful.
You’re still thieving though aren’t you!
Claire Laughs
Still the thieving, you just can’t lose the thieving.
Just out of habit and it…But at least the money now goes on you know like 40 Benson as opposed a little £5 starter pack…of Skag.
It’s lovely, yeah. Aw it’s sweet! It’s nice to see a little a little miracle for Christmas, Rick. Its beautiful.
Yeah, yeah it’s lovely yeah!
Yeah I’m already in the Christmas mood. Are you in the Christmas mood?
I don’t…the thing is though what she’s still got left over from it and these are the scars and the reminders of your smackhead thieving days.
Steve and Claire Laugh
Oh, those little homemade tattoos on her face.
Exactly, exactly.
That she did with a pin!
Yeah, she looks like Seal.
Yeah and some Quink.
Exactly ha-ha.
Yeah, yeah, yeah!
Ah but no, Merry Christmas to you Claire.
Yeah, Merry Christmas.
Thank you, Merry Christmas to you.
You still living in the Projects?
Yeah.
It is, it is one of those little miracles…
She’s still keeping it real, it’s wonderful.
Like that little Tiny Tim.
I tell you what; she’s a bit like Jesus Christ.
In a way yeah, yeah
In a way.
That’s blasphemous, please play a record Claire.
Steve Laughs
Linkin Park - ???

Linkin Park and one of their songs... Gervais, quick, come on mate. He's gotta, he's coming back from the kitchen with a couple of cups of tea. It's like, he's won an award, he don't care now, "I'll turn up whenever I want to." Maybe we should do a "Twin Spin", Sturgess.
Do you want another record?
Yeah, play something, play something.
Here you are then.
Paul Weller - The Changingman
Paul Weller, The Changingman. The Modfather...
That's true enough.
...as they call him.
Absolutely.
You see... now... you... eurgh. You told the listeners that I was just too big to be here because I'd won some award.
Yes.
I was actually making the tea for all of us, wasn't I.
It's awful, this tea.
That's the... That's not the point! I shouldn't be making tea, a man of my position.
You're right, you shouldn't be making tea, this is awful.
Oh...
What, how do you... How do you actually go about the tea? You understand how a cup of tea is made?
But, I, I, I...
You know you've gotta put a tea bag in there?

No, this is weird, right, because I actually can't make a good cup of tea or coffee, and it's strange, it must be something metaphysical. I put all the right ingredients in, just like everyone else does, and I boil the kettle and everything, but people do go, "This is rubbish".
Can I tell you where you're going wrong?
Go on.
Laziness.
Why?
Because you literally don't leave the tea bag in long enough. You literally dunk it in there, and throw it away.
I was trying to get back in time because I've got a show.

No you weren't, I saw you talking with Dermot O'Diddley, so don't give me that. And I've been round to your house before... There's been times, Sturgess, when I've tasted the tea and it's tasted like washing up liquid. And I've said "What happened?" and he went "There were some bubbles in there, yeah...".
Well I...
"Could you not have rinsed it out with some water first?", "No, I didn't have time..."
Well don't... Well yeah, but I, I resent having to make tea.
Yeah, but don't teach me a lesson! You, like, don't offer someone a cup of tea and then think "I'll teach them a lesson, they won't be asking for tea again."
Ricky laughs
Well, it usually works. But, yeah...
I've had to go and get an extra tea bag and dunk it in here, it's ludicrous!
I know, it's mad innit?
It's pathetic. Anyway, it's Christmas, let's not, let's not disrespect each other, let's be cheery.
Yeah.
Can I tell Sturgess what you got your family for Christmas last year? I just remembered when I was outside.
Oh please, please.
It was a joy, because Gervais is a generous man, and he's a thoughtful man, and he's got a lot of brothers and sisters, and a lot of nephews, and, and nieces and stuff...
Well I've got about twenty people to get presents for.
Yeah, you got, exactly, it's a tricky business, that's why I think, was it, you got them two hundred pounds worth of lottery scratch cards.

On the, I er, I had about a minute, I was getting a lift down to Reading, and uh, it was my mate, Jimmy, and uh, I went "Hold on, I've just gotta get the presents!" and I just ran into the 7/11 opposite me and got two hundred quids worth of scratch cards.
That's amazing! It's such a working class, gyppo gift, isn't it?
But, did any of them work? Anyone win anything?
Yeah, yeah. I mean, some people were down, that was your present, hard luck.
Steve laughs
That's the risk you take when you accept this present. Some people were up seventy pounds, so they had a great Christmas.
Let's bare in mind that there's, like, some children who are, like, seven or eight, you know scratching off scratch cards. They've gotta be eighteen to claim them.
Ricky laughs
And just the rest of your family sort of, I can imagine, just wrestling them off. "You can't claim it anyway, sod off."
No it's... "Have I won?", "No, no you haven't, no."
"I've got three dumbells!"
"Three the same, you don't get anything for that, not in this game. Unlucky."
Are you gonna do that again this year?
Maybe, yeah.
Claire laughs
Mercury Rev - The Dark Is Rising
Mercury Rev, The Dark Is Rising. That sounds like, a bit like a tribute to Neil Young.
Beautiful, I thought it was a wonderful record, a, a great record...
It was lovely, we're gonna play some lovely records today...
Oh, there'll be some beautiful songs...
...Steve. Alright?
That's true e- What did you call me then?
Steve.
Claire laughs
Did you call me something else before?
No...
I didn't hear, I thought maybe you'd...
No...
...callled me, I dunno, Jonathan or something.
Claire gasps
No, I don't know, I don't know. Erm... I, I didn't hear, I got paranoid. Erm... Er... Christmas! We were talking about Christmas...
Yeah, we were.
Erm... Gifts... What's wrong now?
I dunno what that meant.
What?
Were you having a go at me because I went on the Jonathan Ross show?
No, no, no, I thought you'd said something, you'd said my name by mis-, you'd said someone else's name when you were talking to me...
Oh right.
...but I didn't hear that, so when I heard you just go "Steve", I thought you were correcting a mistake you hadn't made.
No, no...
Exactly.
Ok, alright.
You see? Blunder.
Ricky laughs
What did you call me?
Steve laughs
Fatty.
Ricky laughs
Good.
Erm...
Right...
Er...
We were talking about Christmas, yeah.
Yes, yes...
Well it is Christmas innit?
'Cause it's just the fact that, it's...
It's the right time of year to talk about it to be honest, it's topical.
Steve laughs
So... Let's carry on, go on, shoot.
Well, I just wondered if your Christmas, er, gift buying had always been as, er, thoughtful as it is...
Oh, well no that was, you see that was actually, even though it was sort of pretty lazy and thoughtless, it was quite generous in a sense...
Yes...

...the financial se- But I remember... Oh... Oh God... Now, even though I sort of come from a working class, a working class family, and my dad was, erm, you know, a labourer and my mum was, like, a housewife, BUT, I was spoilt at Christmas. I, you know, I didn't have like pocket money, or gifts and that, but, you know, she'd get it out the catalogue and pay for it the first year, so I did have great presents.
Yeah.

And 'cause I had older brothers and sisters, they were earning, so I had good presents. And it was ok for me to, you know, give them nothing, or do a card, or something rubbish, but then I remember one year when I just suddenly realised I was too old to be doing this. It was like, it was like, you know in Jaws when it pulls focus...
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
...and you go "Oh my God", and I just realised, "That's the worst present you've ever...". I think I was about twelve or thirteen, and, I remember it now, my sister had got me a Cat Stevens album...
Great.
...I think a, a, a birdhouse, er, and, like, a quiz book...
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
...or something. And, it was my turn to give her her present, and it was a bottle of shampoo that I'd found in the bathroom and wrapped up.
Steve laughs
It was a big, jumbo, one of those Tescos, you know...
Had it not already been used?
No, I don't think so, my mum had bought it, like, you know...
You just topped it up with water, wrapped it up.
And I just, no I just gave it to her and she went, "Oh, thanks." and I thought...
That's outrageous!
..."Oh, God, that's rubbish."
That's really bad.
It's rubbish innit?
That's really bad.
I know, yeah.
I remember one year, erm, I really wanted a Scalextric, and I was going, "I want a Scalextric." and my mum was going, "No, you'll just get bored of it, I know what you're like..."
Yep.

"...you'll get bored of it and we'll have spent all that money and you'll be bored." And I was going, "No, I won't, I'll love it, I'll love it, I'll play with it forever." and they said, and she was going, "No, you won't, you won't." and I was going, "I will, I'll love it." And so she bought me a Scalextric, and I unwrapped it, and I was using it, I was using it, I was bored instantly.
Yeah.
But I didn't tell her, I pretended I loved it, and so, like, I'd always be playing it monotonously, hating it...
I know.
...going, "I'm loving this, mum, this is absolutely brilliant, you were wrong, you were so wrong, I'm loving it."

I know... Er, er, er, the thing is with Scalextrics, I, I think it was great at the time, but you, erm, I think it was an Xfm party actually, years ago, when they got Scalextrics, and loads of adults thinking, "Oh yeah, I used to love it. Rubbish."
Yeah, really rubbish.
It's, it's tiny...
Yeah.
...it's about two foot long...
Yeah.
...you go...
Ricky makes a car noise
..."Put it back, put it back on."...
Yeah, exactly.
..."There you go."...
Ricky makes another car noise
..."Oh, could you put it back on?"
Exactly.
Ricky makes a car noise, again...
You want it, you want it to at least, kind of, change into a robot...
Yeah.
...or kind of, come off and just drive round the...
Course, these days it's all virtual, Steve...
That's true enough.
...innit? In your mind...
Well, we all take a pill...
Yep, yep...
...don't we, Rick and then we're in some kind of fantasy world...
...and then, yeah, I am, I am Ayrton Sennor for a little while.
What about those bloody computer games...
Ohh, God...
...no one's reading a book anymore, are they?!
"Mummy, what's a tree?", "Download."
That's true enough.

Well, I tell you what, I'm gonna play a song now... I think I've dissed U2 for about fifteen years, but I got 'em wrong and I'm gonna play a lovely track off, erm, the latest album, it's the last track on the album, Ground Beneath Her Feet, it's from, er, All You Can't Leave Behind...
Beautiful song.
...and, er, I think it's one of their greatest works.
U2 - The Ground Beneath Her Feet
Oasis - Live Forever
Live Forever, Oasis. Still good that one.
It is very good.
It's mad, isn't it?
Long time ago, aye?
Amazing...
Cor, all those years ago, when they were setting out, they were great and they...
Yeah, before they became embarrassing.
Well, they might, they could still come back...
They could still come back.
Their, their last album's not as good as their, you know, their first one and two and, you know, but, you know, who knows, Steve?
Well, exactly, exactly.
Yeah... Go on.
Erm... it's been a good year for hip hop, Rick. Can I surprise you...
Go on.
...err, I've gone off hip hop of recent years, but I've, er, I've been charmed this year by Bubba Sparxxx' album, I thought was fun...
Yeah, sure, sure, sure...
...erm, I think De La Soul had an album this year which I've enjoyed, that was good, very good...
Yep, they did, they did, they did...
...er, I didn't mind the Jay-Z album...
Er, you see I liked a couple of tracks on that..
Yeah, some alright on there, I actually quite liked...
Izzo was great...
...this new Outkast compilation, don't know if that's out yet or maybe it's just gonna come out in the new year...
I was disappointed by the album, I bought it on the street...
Well, Rick, can I surprise you, there's a new little compilation...
I like the little owl, I like the owl and the cat and the dog...
The new little compilation, Rick...
Go on...
...has lots of tracks from their previous albums and other singles and it's a good little dynamite buy. There's...
Steve...
...something for the new year in the sales.
...just gonna make a note of that, I'm gonna buy that on the way home.
Do it. Erm, but the album that I was particularly charmed by, Princess Superstar Is.
Well I...
Now a lot of people have been dismissing her as a bit of a novelty...
No...
...er, sort of rapper, erm...
They said the same about Timmy Mallet, so don't listen to them. Don't listen to them!
That's what I'm saying, so, erm, another track we, we played a while back, Untouchable Part 2, which was dynamite...
Yep...
...and this is another track, I think this was a single, it's called, er, Bad Babysitter, she raps very quickly, but listen carefully because the lyrics are fun.
Slow it down a little bit, Claire, so we can hear it.
Steve laughs
Princess Superstar - Bad Babysitter
Princess Superstar - Bad Babysitter
Tell us about it, Steve.
From the album, Princess Superstar Is, Princess Superstar and Bad Babysitter... Did you enjoy it, Rick?
Yeah, I did...
Good, good...
Yeah, I, I, I like that...
Yeah...
That's two, that's two out of two from that album I've liked.
Yeah, exactly.
I think I'll go and buy the album on the way home...
Do it, make another note of that, Rick...
...just make a little note...
You've got Outkast to buy...
...of that, Outkast...
...which has not actually been released yet, but I'm sure you can pull some strings.
I'll, er, yeah, I'll get someone onto that...
Jolly good.
Good, ok, Xfm 104.9, it's The Ricky Gervais Show.
Absolutely.
Can I stop you there?
Go on.
With Steve Merchant.
Thanks very much.

No worries, yeah, cheers. Er, talking about presents earlier and I've just remembered something else I had. Erm, er, I was, I was just into science from like, the age of like 5, 6 to about, erm, I suppose 18, 19. I'm still into it, but, erm, I studied it and I absolutely loved it, and I got a microscope set, when I was about, I suppose 10 or 11, and, er, just looking at butterfly wings and just anything under there, like, three hundred times, I thought, "This is amazing." right? And in it came these little shrimp eggs, and, er, you can look at them and then you could sort of, you could breed them. You had to put them in salt water solution and then keep them at a certain temperature and they think, "Ooh, and a nice little beach." and then they'd come out.
Yeah.
What I did, speed up the process a little bit.
Steve laughs
Popped it on the electric fire...
Claire laughs
...right, on a, we had a fake, one of those fake plastic coal things with one of those little metal things that turned round from the heat and made it look like flames... It didn't.
No...
I'll be honest, it didn't.
'Cause, who the hell was fooled...
Yeah.
...someone's coming in going, "You've got a lovely roaring fire there."
Ricky laughs
Yeah, yeah, "The flames are encased behind that plastic coal..."
Exactly.
"...but I love it." Popped them on there, left them there for a little while. Bit too hot.
Steve laughs
Came back, hmm, just melted really, just dry and the thing was slightly warped. So, them shrimps did not see the light of day.
Once again, your laziness...
Yeah.
...and slothfulness just, "I've gotta speed up the experiment, come on..."
Absolutely.
"...I, I can advance nature...
Yeah, exactly...
"...come on!
...yeah. Erm...
Do you stand in front of a microwave just going, "Come on!"
"Come on, come on." Yeah...
"A minute and a half for soup?"
It's ridiculous, isn't it?
Steve laughs
Yeah, so...
That's majestic.
Yeah, but I learnt my lesson...
Yeah...
...now I, I, I make sure the shrimps are the right temperature.
Exactly.
That's terrible, isn't it.
You reminded me of something I was gonna say then, but I can't remember. I've embarrassed myself live on air.
Yeah...
Should've kept that quiet...
Ricky laughs
...no one would've known! No one was there thinking, "I wish Steve would say something now, it's crazy, I hope he thinks up a story."
"What's Steve gonna say!?" Yeah.
I know what it was, it was about, you said about the, erm, about the sort of, the fire and that, that idea of kind of buying a-. It's like when people buy a fake Rolex watch...
Yeah.
...and they tell people it's fake. Utter waste of time.
Yeah.
Why have you told me that? It's like, what, you're not, you're, "I'm getting one over on the Rolex people!"
But, you, you, you, you're, you're right and that's right, but the point is why buy a fake Rolex watch? I mean, why buy a Rolex watch, I'm trying to think, they're more expensive...
Well, they look good, they look nice.
Yeah.
And it's a, but it's a transparent display of wealth, but it's  when there's like a builder, who you knows on, like, five pound an hour, wearing a Rolex.
You're joking aren't you, Steve?
Steve laughs
Pod carriers can get upward of five hundred and fifty pounds a day.
Steve laughs
So you've embarrassed yourself.
I don't know anything, it seems like I don't know anything about the building industry anymore.
Ricky laughs
Unbelievable.
Do you know once I, my friend showed off this watch that he'd bought and, a guy, a sort of dodgy bloke had sold it to him on the street...
Yeah.

...and he'd been up in London and some guy on Oxford Street had sold him this watch, and it looked really good, and it worked fine for years, and, and it just looked classy, and I thought, "Wow, that's brilliant." And I came to London, for something, and I walked up and down Oxford Street for two and a half hours, trying to get sold a dodgy watch. And I'd be going up to people, like, selling lighters and going, "Yeah, not interested in lighters, got any, er, watches?"
Yeah.
And he'd go, "No, I haven't got any watches..."
Yeah.
"...go down to the perfume guy." And I'd go down to the perfume guy, "Yo, any watches?"
I love the idea of, they saw you go down, "Can I have a watch?" and they go, "No."
I know.

"It's a... bad advertisement, mate. If people see you walking around with this it's not good for trade" "What, how dare you. Send me one of those stolen watches." "Can't do it mate. More than my job's worth."
Ten Benson – Black Snow
Ten Benson that’s  Black Snow, that’s a great tune.
Good song isn’t it.
I love it. It’s sort punk but it’s got more in common with stuff like Steppenwolf and Bad Company.
My only worry is that erm, are they like eighteen year olds who, like Gomez, are trying to sound like they’ve kind of had a rough hard living life?
No no no.
They are old fourty somethings?
Well no no they’re not they sort of but they’re, they’re dirty.
Good good.
Yeh.
You notice that Steve Taylor, the man with the knowledge, just popped in then.
Just popped in.
Wished us a merry Christmas and I noticed Claire you said something like err, has he got another kid did you say?
Yeh.
How many children has he got?
I think he’s got the two now. Yeh.
Clearly he has got the knowledge hasn’t he, in every sense.
Yeh.
I imagine he’s a great lover.
He knows…
I imagine he’s got wonderful fingers.
He knows what buttons.
Magic fingers.
Well he’s actually got little toady hands, he uses a lot of utensils.
Steve Laughs
Yes.
He's invented all these little things that go…
Ricky makes electronic noises
Exactly.
And it’s over very quickly so he can get on with learning.
Pleasure gloves!
Yeh cos even when he’s making love there’s a stack of trivia books.
Exactly, exactly.
Well he can tell you about great shags of the past.
Yeh yeh he’s heard here he comes.
Here he comes.
Oh I love him cos you don’t know this listeners but he looks like Penfold off of DangerMouse.
He’s a beautiful man. It hasn’t stopped him breeding!
Yeh yeh it’s not usually called breeding.
The man with the...
You don’t usually call it breeding when it’s humans.
Ricky and Steve Clap
Steve Taylor the man with the knowledge.
Come in, come in.
Merry Christmas to you.
It’s like Steve Wright and his posse. Alright Merry Christmas.
Hi.
Hi.
Hi.
Stop that now.
Are you a great ladies man, were you a great ladies man before you were married?
It’s not the sort of thing I normally talk about, I’m married now.

Because right, because he’s sort of like got a little shaved head and he’s got a beard and its exactly the same colour sort of ginger hair he looks like a tennis ball. It’s just hair of exactly the same length all over his head.
There was no reason for me to come in was there. The abuse was happening without me here.
Yeh I know.
And now I’ve come in you just continue.
But say hello so it’s with your blessing and they’ll think were nice. Say Merry Christmas.
Hi, Merry Christmas all listeners.
So you’re on at five o clock aren’t you?
Erm… yeh.
Right I’m going to make a note of that.
Make a note of that.
When I’ve bought those two albums I’m going to listen to Steve Taylor the man with the knowledge on at 5 o’clock on Xfm.
Rick isn’t it incredible because he’s been in since 11 o’clock this morning just compiling information for every record he’ll be playing, the shows only 20 minutes long.
You know with him it’s cos he’s gotta offload it.
Yeh.
He’s gotta talk about it all the time cos you know he’s got a huge brain and its...
Ricky makes a throbbing sound
…it’s going.
Throbbing.
All information.
What you playing next Claire?
Are you bored? Sorry were we boring you, you two?
It’s just that list, isn’t it cute yeh.
Can you tell us about Starsailor what do you know, some interesting facts about Starsailor?
Come on into the microphone, into the micropole that goes down the loudybox and out to the radiograph in the homes all around Engloid.
Steve Laughs
They’re rubbish.
Thank you.
Steve Taylor, controversial view. Still he has bred people.
The Hives – Main Offender
Hives, Hives. Before that Starsailor. It’s been a bit of a punk sort of show this hasn’t it.
It has and I’ve enjoyed it.
You know the whole years been a little bit of a, I blame the strokes but you see I, I, I enjoyed punk, you were too young and don’t care for it but.
Well I have to say if punk the first time round was exciting as I’ve found it this year then I’ve missed out because I’ve really enjoyed it, really enjoyed it.
See I wanna go and play you all my things like X-Ray Spex and you know things like that now.
Are they as kind of melodic though as things like The Strokes and erm White Stripes and so on? Are they kind of tuneful? ‘Cos…
Well.
…The White Stripes album…
Well in fact I’ve picked a very bad example because they were sort of like pop punk and Poly Styrene was almost she wasn’t a… wasn’t a joke but erm they had saxophones and stuff so it’s like.
Right.
So it’s probably a bad example of early punk. I mean The Sex Pistols summed it all up.
Yeh sure sure.
But err well we we enjoyed that didn’t we.
We did I have to say though although there has been a nice bit of sort of punky sound this year, for me it’s been very much a year for the geeks. You’d have thought id of enjoyed that but actually...
Well that’s nu metal though isn’t it?
Well it is the nu metal.
These people who are like in their bedroom playing sort of computer games and listening to Limp Bizkit…
I can’t believe that nu metal has taken over the world. It’s just incredible.
Its mad isn’t it, it’s absolutely huge.
Suddenly Linkin Park and err...
See I don’t mind things like Marilyn Manson cos they’re you know they’re having a go and they’re having a bit of a laugh and you know, but I just.
